subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] On PALM
msgSnippet: ... That doesn t matter to me. I will use these letter combinations for the news since I have heard no good counter argument to do otherwise. ... That is not
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> Paul Tremblay scripsit:
>
> > merry Ed Roar (er)
> > Mary Age Roar (Er)
> > marry Ash Roar (Ar)
>
> These are different from the others because the /r/ is in the following
> syllable, which is why even non-rhotics pronounce it.

That doesn't matter to me. I will use these letter combinations for the
news since I have heard no good counter argument to do otherwise.

>
> > mire Ice Roar (Fr)
>
> This is two syllables also, but the /r/ is the NURSE vowel, so I'd write
> it I-Utter-Roe. Read (an RP speaker) probably can't hear the distinction
> between this word and the words listed below.

That is not how I pronounce it, since I rhyme it with "fire." According
to dictionary.com, fire is pronounced /faIr/. So words like fire will be
spelled <qs>fFr</qs>.

>
> > mar Ah Roar (yR)
> > more Awl Roar (Yr)
> > mere If Roar (ir)
> > murder Ado Roar (ar)
>
> These are the true vowel+r combinations that should (and do) have
> ligatures. Read doesn't tell us about "mare" and "moor", but the fact that
> he spells "mere" with It says he favors what we've been calling Choice 1.
> I don't think that's necessarily definitive, though.
>

I don't have any idea what choice #1 was at this point. But I believe
the combinations Read describes allow me to use spellings unambiguous
and satisfying to everyone.

Paul
